ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwàʼne fóo mbwó mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ, ngàŋatsǎŋ, ńtí nò Yěsô Keleto. Peg Timotê gẅie aa fɛ̌ wɔ̀gɔ nzèm Yěsô Keleto náa yɔɔn ŋwàʼne á mbwó gù Filemoŋ. Ɔɔ fɛ̌ weg we tʉ̀nzẅìŋ, pege metsèm pǔ faʼa na nò Yěsô Keleto.
en: Paul,   a prisoner  # 1 2Tm 1:8; Heb 13:3 of Christ Jesus,  # 1 Rm 1:1 and Timothy  # 1 Ac 16:1; 1Tm 1:2 our brother:

ngiemboon: Áa jú, ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ ye Apia, afɛ̌ wege wemanzwě, mbɔɔ ye Aleshʉ́pè, á ngàŋakwò wege tsẅɛɛ ncù, ńgÿo cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie á kúu ndá gù.
en: to Apphia our sister,   to Archippus  # 2 Col 4:17 our fellow soldier,  # 2 Php 2:25 and to the church that meets in your home.  # 2 Ac 12:12; Rm 16:5

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto ne ńcÿó gʉm gí, ńne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè na pi!
en: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Fɛ̌ wɔɔn Filemoŋ, n ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńké ńkwaŋte gú kwaŋte, é síe Ssé, á yé gẅie n guʼte.
en: I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers,

ngiemboon: E sie yé á nue n ne ńjúʼu mé laʼte ntí nkwòŋe gie ɔ̀ gẅiin nzèm pʉ̀a Ssé mbɔɔ ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m gú na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto.
en: because I hear of your love   for all the saints and the faith that you have in the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: N ne sẅíŋte Ssé ngie à lɔg páʼ lezǎb ntʉ́m na yé, à temte wege la, ńgÿo ngie ɔ̀ cwoŋo ńzsé menò mbòŋo mie á zɛ́te ngie pege gÿo tá ńdɔgɔ faʼa mbwó Keleto.
en: I pray that your participation in the faith may become effective   through knowing every good thing  # 6 Gn 1:31; 18:18; 3Jn 11 that is in us  # 6 Other mss read in you for the glory of Christ.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn nue, nkwòŋe gie ɔ̀ gẅiin, e ka gÿo m bú ńkág tɛʼ. Afɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn, ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn sẅeté, á fóo na páʼ ɔ̀ ka kẅiŋte pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed   through you, brother.

ngiemboon: N gee ngàŋntúm Keleto, n tsɛ ńkuʼu léshwóŋo gú mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gÿo táʼ, á fó na mmó gie ɔ̀ ne gÿo,
en: For this reason, although I have great boldness in Christ to command you to do what is right,

ngiemboon: n gyá ngie n ge cʉa na nkwòŋe yɔ̀gɔ, ésẅíŋte gú sẅíŋte. Tà mbɔɔ páʼ mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ, n cʉ̌ʼ pɔ́ nzẅìŋe ndÿò, n gíŋe ńgwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ ndátsǎŋ, ńtí Yěsô Keleto lɔɔn.
en: I appeal to you, instead, on the basis of love. I, Paul, as an elderly man   and now also as a prisoner  # 9 2Tm 1:8; Heb 13:3 of Christ Jesus,

ngiemboon: N ne sẅíŋte gú na twó Onezim, aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn na nò Yěsô gẅie n ka kúu ndátsǎŋ ńzyé.
en: appeal to you for my son,   Onesimus.  # 10 In Gk, Onesimus means “useful”,# 10 Col 4:9 I became his father  # 10 1Co 4:15 while I was in chains.

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, ɔ̀ těen ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ yé wɔ́ táʼ, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ɔ̀ ge gwaa ne zẅɛ́ʼɛ yé, n ne ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ yé yɔ́ɔn.
en: Once he was useless to you, but now he is useful both to you and to me.

ngiemboon: N tumó yé ngie à piŋ nzèm ńtsɛ́ɛ gú. Aa pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ twó tʉ́m yɔ́ɔn.
en: I am sending him back to you #— #I am sending my very own heart.  ,# 12 Lit you #— #that is, my own heart

ngiemboon: N gyǎ ngie á kɔʼɔ́ ḿboŋ ngie à gwɔ́ pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, é ne kẅéte wɔ́ɔn na fàʼ gie ɔ́ kɔʼɔ́ ńgwɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ faʼ, á na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn gie n gee menkÿo, ńtí nkʉ̀ mbòŋo lɔɔn.
en: I wanted to keep him with me, so that in my imprisonment for the gospel he might serve me in your place.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, n kaa kwoŋo légÿo tsɔ́ mmó tà ɔ̀ júʼu jǔʼ wɔ́. N té ne ńkwoŋo létsóte gú tsóte tá ɔ̀ gÿo nò mbòŋo na mèŋ wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ kwǒŋ.
en: But I didn’t want to do anything without your consent, so that your good deed might not be out of obligation, but of your own free will.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̀ʼ, mbà à ka naʼá fó lejʉ́ŋ gù, ńgʉa légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge gÿo gíŋe gwaa gyá yé, à gwɔ́ páʼ pi yé ge cʉ́ʼʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: For perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a brief time, so that you might get him back permanently,

ngiemboon: Á le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwɔɔn wɔ́. À cʉa nkwɔɔn, ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fɛ̌ gù gẅie ɔ̀ ge kwoŋo yé tɛʼ. Aa mbwó mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́ʼɔ páʼ à ge gwɔ́ mbwó gù? À ge gwɔ́ mbwó gù, é gwaa gwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ɔ, é gíŋe gwɔ́ fɛ̌ gù nzèm Yěsô Keleto.
en: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave #— #as a dearly loved brother. He is especially so to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh   and in the Lord.  # 16 1Co 16:19; Rv 11:8

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ zsě ngie pɔ̀gɔ ee kwò, ɔ̀ kúe yé páʼ á kɔʼɔ́ péʼe ńgwɔ́ wɔ́ɔn, mbà ɔ̀ kǔe wɔ́ɔn púʼu,
en: So if you consider me a partner, welcome   him as you would me.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie à la cʉŋte tsɔ́ mmó mbwó gù, kà ɔ̀ ne ńkʉ́a pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó mbwó yé wɔ́ɔ, ɔ̀ nyé, n gÿo ńtÿó mbwó gù.
en: And if he has wronged you in any way, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ zɔ lɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn, ńŋweʼe yɔɔn jʉʼ ngie n ge gÿo tÿó mbwó gù. Táʼ, zsé ngie n gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, n zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ tÿó mbwó mèŋ, á gwɔ́ páʼ ɔ̀ gwaa gẅiin légwɔ́ gẅie ɔ̀ gẅiin fʉ̀ʼɔɔn tɛʼ, ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ pɔ́ wɔ́ɔn.
en: I, Paul, write this with my own hand:   I will repay it #— #not to mention to you that you owe me even your very self.

ngiemboon: Afɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn, tsétsɔʼ lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgÿo mmó gie n ne ńdúɔ mbwó gù. Lɔg páʼ pɔ̀gɔ pǔ ńda nnɛ́ na Keleto, ḿbʉ́le ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn.
en: Yes, brother, may I benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ pɔ́ páʼ ɔɔ nyìŋ ńjúʼ ncwò tá ńŋweʼe yɔɔn ŋwàʼne. N ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo mmó gie n ne ńzɛ́te mbwó gù tà tɔ́g púʼu.
en: Since I am confident of your obedience, I am writing to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

ngiemboon: Gíŋe ńnyɛte lûmndá, ńdɔg ńzẅíʼte wɔ́ɔn, á nue n ne ńkwaŋa ngie e Ssé lɔɔn júʼu sẅíŋtè gí, mbà mé ge gíŋe tsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn é ná né pi.
en: Meanwhile, also prepare a guest room for me, since I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

ngiemboon: Epafalásè gẅie peg yé pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndátsǎŋ ńtí nò Yěsô Keleto tsyɛʼté gú.
en: Epaphras,   my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings, and so do

ngiemboon: Málákúsè, mbɔɔ Alisetag, mbɔɔ Ndemásè pɔ́ Lúkáasè pie peg lâ pɔ̌ pǔ faʼa tàʼa fàʼ giŋé ńtsyɛʼte gú yɔ́b.
en: Mark,   Aristarchus,  # 24 Ac 19:29 Demas, and Luke,  # 24 Col 4:14; 2Tm 4:10–11 my coworkers.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto lɔgɔ légwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi, ńne ńcÿó gʉm gí!
en: The grace of the Lord  ,# 25 2Th 3:18; Rv 11:8 Jesus Christ be with your spirit.  # 25 Ps 51:12
